TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi beforefieldinit X509CertificateCollection/X509CertificateEnumerator extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.IEnumerator

remarks.format:
## Remarks Enumerators provide read-only access to the data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection.X509CertificateEnumerator.Reset%2A> method also brings the enumerator back to this position. At this position, calling the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection.X509CertificateEnumerator.Current%2A> property throws an exception. Therefore, you must call the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection.X509CertificateEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection.X509CertificateEnumerator.Current%2A>.
This class inherits from the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface. For more information about enumerating over a collection, see <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection mappings) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified .

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection.X509CertificateEnumerator> does not move the position of the enumerator. Consecutive calls to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection.X509CertificateEnumerator.Current%2A> property return the same object until either the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection.X509CertificateEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection.X509CertificateEnumerator.Reset%2A> method is called.

Docs.exception: The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection or after the last element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool MoveNext() cil managed

Docs.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the collection.
Docs.returns: if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method advances the enumerator to the next element in the collection. For more information about enumerating over a collection, see the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> topic.

Docs.exception: The collection was modified after the enumerator was instantiated.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Reset() cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first element in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection.X509CertificateEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection.X509CertificateEnumerator.Reset%2A> method throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.

Docs.exception: The collection is modified after the enumerator is instantiated.

Docs.value: The current X.509 certificate object in the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface.

Docs.exception: The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection or after the last element.
